channel.title: Signoz
channel.description: Signoz is a blog about open telementry.

item.title: OpenTelemetry vs Prometheus - differences, use-cases and alternatives
item.description: OpenTelemetry and Prometheus are both open-source projects under Cloud Native Computing Foundation. One is used for managing telemetry data and the other is a metrics monitoring tool..
item.author: undefined (undefined)

item.title: Prometheus Query Tutorial with examples
item.description: Prometheus Query Language (PromQL) lets users query and aggregate metrics data in Prometheus for further analysis. In this tutorial, we will learn about Prometheus Query Language and see it in action using examples of PromQL...
item.author: undefined (undefined)

item.title: Prometheus vs InfluxDB - Key Differences, concepts, and similarities
item.description: Prometheus and InfluxDB are both open-source projects that can be used for monitoring time-series data. While Prometheus is a metrics monitoring tool graduated under CNCF, InfluDB is a time-series database. In this article, letâ€™s have a side-to-side review of Prometheus vs InfluxDB to...

item.title: Prometheus vs Elasticsearch stack - Key concepts, features, and differences
item.description: Both Prometheus and Elasticsearch stack provide monitoring solutions for applications in production. But while Prometheus is focused on metrics monitoring, the Elasticsearch stack or the ELK stack specializes in logs...

item.title: DataDog vs Prometheus - Key features & differences
item.description: In this article, we will compare DataDog with Prometheus. Both are monitoring tools but differ significantly in their offerings. DataDog is a paid SaaS monitoring tool, while Prometheus is an open-source metrics...
item.author: undefined (undefined)

item.title: Jaeger vs Prometheus - Key differences, use-cases and alternatives
item.description: Both Jaeger and Prometheus are popular open-source application performance monitoring tools. While Jaeger is an end-to-end distributed tracing tool, Prometheus is used as a time-series database for monitoring metrics. Let's dive in to explore their key features and differences.
item.author: undefined (undefined)

item.title: Setting up HA Prometheus with Cortex and Cassandra
item.description: In this blog, we explain how we enable high availability Prometheus using Cortex and Cassandra. This provides a single pane of view across multiple clusters - which enables visualising all monitoring metrics in one go.
item.author: undefined (undefined)

item.title: My 7 key takeaways from PromCon 2019
item.description: PromCon is one of the premier conference on Prometheus and related tools like Grafana. This is held every year where developers from around the world gather to learn the latest in monitoring technologies.
item.author: undefined (undefined)

item.title: Monitoring OpenMetrics for Gunicorn and Django application in Prometheus
item.description: In this blog, let's see how to set up Prometheus and Grafana in EKS and how to monitor Python based applications using Prometheus.
